borderline.translation[0].definitions[0]: very close to not being acceptable
In borderline cases, the student’s coursework is considered, as well as exam grades.
borderline.translation[0].definitions[1]: having qualities of both one situation, state etc and another more extreme situation or state
a borderline schizophrenic  (=someone who has some signs of being mentally ill)
borderline.translation[1].definitions[0]: the point at which one quality, situation, emotion etc ends and another begins
She slipped over the borderline into sleep.
I was on the borderline between a first- and a second-class degree.
